message: I love all of them ;)
My favorites are TWiT (of course), TWiG, FLOSS Weekly, and net@night
Also security now when I'm in a particularly geeky mood :)

3-way tie for the best, must-see TWiT.TV shows in my book (all for different reasons/qualities): Security Now, Windows Weekly and TWiT. TNT should be there and will be when they settle on a strong panel, hopefully one with Becky on it more often.
TWiT, TNT, Security Now, WW, Frame Rate, Fourcast... in no particular order.
TWiG is my favorite for sure, second to MacBreak for the cohosts and guests (Merlin Mann is great). Then probably TWiT, Security Now, TNT - in no real order.
break it
I luv em all, but always hum Enigma song: "TNT for yer brain!".. equality...
I'd have to say I have a few. My main ones are TWiT, TWiG, Net @ Nite, and TNT
TNT
Security Now because of how technical Steve Gibson gets... Love TwiT as well... Then TNT... lastly Floss (if they went into code more)
I like Tech News Today, ipad Today, The Tech Guy!, Net@Night, Frame Rate, Fourcast, This Week in Google
TWiG MBW TNT
1. TNT 2. TWiT 3. Framerate

I love The Daily Giz Wiz, Net@Nite, and iPad Today (even though I don't have an iPad). I listen to MacBreak Weekly, but sometimes they can go way too far off the deep end of nerdiness. I say this as a loyal Mac user. Paul and Leo have a great rapport with Windows Weekly, and I usually listen to TWiG, TWiT, and Security Now. But for each of those last three, some episodes go way long and lose the flow.
@unwrangle Jeff is brilliant! Love that dude.
net@night, TWIG (Gina and Jeff are great) and TWIT (Dvorak is so funny)
used to never missed twig as well. but recently it becomes more and more Jeff's political view on tech news / companies. not particularly interesting, so i could care less.
net@night and TWiT
never miss: twit, windows, macbreak. catch on re-run: tnt, gizwiz, ipad, framerate, security now.

TWiT when Dvorak's on. Otherwise it's probably N@N.
TNT, cause i watch it daily. "The Turpster" is on of my favorite pundits.

Dvorak has been pissing me off lately. He's lost the magic that used to entertain me. Now he's always trying to do little standup bits, wearing silly hats or shirts, lame stories or one-liners. Instead of talking about tech in his straight-forward and funny way, we've got a less-funny Carrot-Top on our hands.
net@night with Leo and Amber Mac.

I like the all the big hitters. Its my way of dippin my toes into the tech waters.
